item.title: SHL Medical boosts learning on the 2024 NSTC Science Train
item.dc:creator: shl_manager2
item.content:encoded:
October 21, 2024 – Taoyuan, Taiwan – SHL Medical is proud to announce its continued participation in the NSTC Science Train Program for the third consecutive year. In collaboration with the National Science and Technology Council (NSTC), SHL reaffirms its commitment to advancing science education in Taiwan through interactive scientific activities designed to inspire the next generation of innovators.    

Scheduled between October 21-26, the Science Train—featuring a designated SHL Medical carriage focused on precision healthcare—will traverse 27 stations across 16 counties and cities in Taiwan. Throughout the ride, students from 30 elementary schools will engage in a series of physics experiments that are designed by teachers and students from Taoyuan Senior High School, Dayuan Senior High School, Pingtung Senior High School, and Tamkang Senior High School. These experiments aim to ignite students' interests toward science while promoting public awareness on scientific knowledge.    

[caption id="attachment_38134" align="aligncenter" width="1200"] Sebastian Feng, General Manager of SHL Medical Taiwan, (fifth from the left), participated in a group photo with representatives from corporate sponsors of the NSTC Science Train, guests, and elementary school students at the opening press conference, celebrating the launch of the Science Train's island-wide tour.[/caption]

Sebastian Feng, General Manager of SHL Medical Taiwan, remarked: “At SHL Medical, we are committed to supporting initiatives like the NSTC Science Train Program that inspire young minds to explore the wonders of science. As the pioneering leader in self-injection solutions, SHL Medical values the opportunity to share our expertise. This year, we extend our sincere appreciation to Professor Wei-Chin Hung from the R.O.C. Military Academy for designing a series of engaging science experiments to help students understand key concepts such as pressure, friction, as well as the principles behind precise drug delivery. This further emphasizes SHL’s role in nurturing educational initiatives that spark future innovations in advanced drug delivery systems.”   

This initiative not only enhances the educational experience for students but also highlights SHL’s role in elevating the young minds and nurturing scientific advancement. The Science Train closing ceremony will be held at Nangang Station, Taipei, on October 26, marking the culmination of a week-long journey of discovery and inspiration.   

[caption id="attachment_38136" align="aligncenter" width="1200"] Sebastian Feng, General Manager of SHL Medical Taiwan joined a group photo in front of SHL Medical carriage with teachers and students from Dayuan Senior High School and Fude Elementary School on the first day of the Science Train event.[/caption]

The Science Train is just one of the several initiatives SHL launched to strengthen its role in promoting greater education and community engagement in Taiwan. In early August this year, 71 teachers and students from participating high schools visited SHL’s Taoyuan-Liufu site. Throughout the visit, the group was given an exclusive tour of the company’s production lines and laboratories, where they gained insight into the practical application of scientific principles in advanced medical manufacturing. SHL employees also shared their career experiences and helped students enhance their understanding of experimental principles and presentation skills.    

Beyond the Science Train, SHL has collaborated with various schools and institutions in Taiwan to educate and cultivate a young generation of talented and skilled minds. One of the collaborations led to the introduction of SHL-led apprenticeship program that provides local students with hands-on experience in manufacturing operations, including tooling and molding, all under the guidance of seasoned SHL supervisors. This endeavor is further exemplified through the donation of second-hand laptops and monitors to elementary schools in Taoyuan, reinforcing SHL’s commitment to supporting education and community engagement.   

SHL Medical looks forward to inspiring future innovators and supporting advancements in the MedTech industry through meaningful collaborations and sustainable initiatives.

item.title: SHL launches first reusable electromechanical device – the Elexy
item.dc:creator: shl_manager2
item.content:encoded:
SHL Medical, the pioneering leader in self-injection solutions, debuts Elexy™ – a reusable electromechanical drug delivery device solution aimed to support digital therapeutics and a wide range of specialty formulations.

As biotech and pharma partners seek greater flexibility in the choice of drug delivery solutions to navigate the complexities of the drug development process, Elexy responds to this need with its reusable power unit. The power unit seamlessly integrates with disposable drug cassettes that can accommodate both cartridges and pre-filled syringes, supporting a wide range of injection profiles from drug volume, viscosity, and injection speed.

 
Go to Elexy webpage

 

The Elexy device also features connectivity through cellular and Bluetooth® options, supporting the collection of comprehensive data related to drug, container, and device use. Designed with patient-centricity in mind, the Elexy is poised to support the future of digital therapeutics while safeguarding ease of use.

SHL’s Chief Growth Officer Markus Puusepp remarked: “The introduction of Elexy marks a significant milestone for our already expansive device portfolio, further solidifying our leading market position in the drug delivery industry. Following last year’s introduction of the Molly® Connected Cap, it’s quite clear that SHL’s agile response to market demands in innovative self-injection solutions is driving advancements in the market.”

The Elexy will be showcased at the upcoming CPHI Milan, PDA Universe, PODD®, and PDA Aseptic conferences in October. Join us at one of these conferences to learn more about Elexy and SHL’s comprehensive offerings!

item.title: SHL Medical reaffirms commitment to Taiwan
item.dc:creator: shl_manager2
item.content:encoded:
Tuesday, September 3, 2024 – Taipei, Taiwan – SHL Medical, a global leader in the self-injection space, today announced the signing of a Letter of Intent (LOI) with Taiwan’s Ministry of Economic Affairs (MOEA) for the fourth time. This renewed partnership reinforces SHL’s ongoing commitment to bolstering its operations in Taiwan with a significant investment of US$100 million over the next five years.

This strategic investment, aimed at strengthening SHL’s manufacturing capabilities to develop advanced innovative drug delivery technologies, will support the company’s long-term growth ambitions. The planned investment is also in line with Taiwan’s efforts to strengthen its position as a global hub for biotech and pharmaceutical industries.

“We are proud to continue our partnership with Taiwan, a key contributor to SHL’s global operations,” said Sebastian Feng, General Manager of SHL Medical Taiwan. “The signing highlights our confidence in Taiwan’s robust industrial infrastructure and the exceptional talents that drive our innovation forward.”

SHL’s investment will focus on enhancing its operations in Taiwan to meet the growing demand for self-injection devices. The company plans to allocate resources towards advanced automation, workforce development, workplace and equipment upgrades, as well as sustainable manufacturing practices. These initiatives align with SHL’s commitment to enhancing efficiency and its goal to reduce its carbon footprint across its operations.

The announcement follows a series of significant milestones, including the groundbreaking ceremony for its new Taoyuan-Nanmei site and the launch of its electronic vehicle.

“We believe that our continued investment in Taiwan not only supports our growth strategy but also contributes to the local economy and the advancement of the medical technology sector in the region,” Feng added. “We look forward to deepening our collaboration with the MOEA and furthering our shared vision of innovation and excellence.”

The signing took place at the 2024 Taiwan Business Alliance and Market Trend Forum and led by MOEA Minister, Dr. Jyh-Huei Kuo. Participants of the forum include AWS Taiwan and Hong Kong, Boston Consulting Group, Mogan Stanley Securities, SEMI, UBS Securities, and Quanta Computer Co., Ltd.

item.title: Kymanox and SHL Medical enter a non-exclusive strategic partnership agreement to support delivery of modern medicines
item.dc:creator: shl_manager2
item.content:encoded:
Kymanox Corporation (“Kymanox”), a professional services company exclusively serving life sciences, and SHL Medical AG ("SHL"), a world-leading solutions provider of advanced drug delivery systems, announced today that they have signed a non-exclusive strategic partnership agreement. This collaboration establishes a reciprocal preferred partnership between the two industry leaders, combining Kymanox's extensive professional services offering and combination products expertise and SHL's innovative drug delivery solutions, including autoinjectors, pen injectors, and specialty delivery systems for large-volume and high-viscosity formulations.

Recognizing the importance of early engagement, the partnership aims to streamline communication and cooperation between the parties, ultimately adding significant value and efficiency to the drug delivery, development, and commercialization process. The partnership will allow SHL to recommend Kymanox as a trusted professional services firm, renowned for its comprehensive and holistic services spanning early development to commercialization and beyond. Kymanox customers choosing SHL as their device partner will enjoy the collective benefits of this collaboration, including access to shared resources, expertise, and the collective commitment of both companies to deliver high-quality, patient-centric solutions, with each of the organizations focusing on their respective strengths.

"SHL recognizes the importance of fostering relationships between leading players in the drug delivery industry, as no single company can address the complexities of the pharmaceutical landscape alone," said Markus Puusepp, Chief Growth Officer at SHL Medical. "We are excited to solidify our strategic partnership with Kymanox, as their unparalleled experience in supporting product commercialization complements SHL's commitment to providing cutting-edge drug delivery solutions. Our collaboration is a testament to the shared vision of bringing high-quality device solutions to the market efficiently."

The non-exclusive partnership allows Kymanox to continue forging relationships with device manufacturers, pharmaceutical and biotech companies, contract development and manufacturing organizations (CDMOs), and fill-finish providers in the industry. This collaboration is part of Kymanox's vision of creating a dynamic network of leading life sciences organizations as "Kymanox Preferred Partners", promoting shared learning and continuous improvement, and building a comprehensive support system across all stages of drug development and the product lifecycle. For SHL Medical, the partnership enhances its Alliance Management Program, further bolstering the company’s vertically integrated business model by facilitating customer engagement with other key players within the drug delivery ecosystem and providing customers seamless access to a full network of solutions and services. Through this strategic alliance, both companies aim to enhance their respective offerings and drive innovation in the life sciences industry.

Matt Neighoff, Chief Commercial Officer at Kymanox, stated, "Kymanox is proud to continue its strategic collaborations within the healthcare industry, exemplified by the strengthened partnership with SHL, a leader in the design, development, and manufacturing of advanced drug delivery solutions. This agreement demonstrates the companies' joint commitment to supporting our customers on their journey to deliver innovative medicines to patients. We have seen how similar strategic partnerships have helped streamline development projects for our clients and reduced cost and risk. Together, we aim to empower pharmaceutical and biotech companies, ensuring high-quality products reach patients swiftly and efficiently, because patients deserve better."

 

About Kymanox

Kymanox has proven, collaborative, end-to-end solutions that help bring Life Science products to the market – and keep them there. We are a global professional services organization that supports comprehensive drug development with integrated science, engineering, compliance (e.g., QA/RA), and technical project management. Our work across small and large molecules, medical devices, and combination products affords us a wholly unique advantage. With our diverse team of experts, Kymanox helps clients navigate commercialization challenges that arise throughout a product’s life cycle – from early development to post-market – with optimized safety, quality, efficacy, and accessibility. We strive to advance Life Science innovation through insightful solutions and collaboration…because patients deserve better. Kymanox was founded in 2004 and is headquartered in Morrisville, North Carolina USA. Kymanox is backed by WestView Capital Partners, a Boston-based growth equity firm.

For more information, visit https://www.kymanox.com/

item.title: SHL Medical to exhibit at Fakuma 2024
item.dc:creator: shl_manager2
item.content:encoded:
SHL Medical is excited to announce our debut at Fakuma 2024, the world-leading trade event for industrial plastics processing, held between October 15-19 in Friedrichshafen, Germany.

SMC Mould Innovation, which was acquired by SHL Medical earlier this year, will be participating with us at Booth A1-1013 in Messe Friedrichshafen. We will share our expertise on the latest advancements in tooling and molding technologies and explore opportunities for innovation and collaboration for the pharmaceutical, medtech, packaging, and technology industries. We will also showcase our comprehensive tooling capabilities and high-precision, multi-cavity molds for self-injection devices, such as the Molly® modular autoinjector platform and the cartridge-based Maggie® autoinjector family of devices.

Founded in 1925, SMC Mould Innovation is a renowned and well-respected Swiss manufacturer of high-performance injection molding tools. Visitors can learn about SMC Mould Innovation and SHL Medical’s integrated operations and service network for tooling development, manufacturing, and maintenance in this event. 

We look forward to greeting you in Friedrichshafen!

 
Book a meeting

 

When: October 15-19

Where: Messe Friedrichshafen, Friedrichshafen, Germany  |  Hall 1  |  Booth A1-1013

item.title: SHL Medical and Grand River Aseptic Manufacturing forge strategic partnership to offer fill finish services for RTU cartridge used in Maggie 5.0® autoinjector
item.dc:creator: shl_manager2
item.content:encoded:
SHL Medical, a world-leading solutions provider of advanced drug delivery systems such as autoinjectors, pen injectors, and innovative specialty delivery systems has announced a strategic partnership with Grand River Aseptic Manufacturing (GRAM), a highly regarded contract development and manufacturing organization (CDMO) specializing in sterile injectable biologics and scalable pharmaceutical manufacturing solutions tailored to diverse client needs. The collaboration aims to introduce fill-finish services for the RTU cartridge used in Maggie® 5.0 autoinjector.

The Maggie® 5.0 mL, an extension of SHL’s cartridge-based 3.0 mL Maggie autoinjector, is designed for large-volume drug delivery. Equipped with SHL’s proven Needle Isolation Technology (NIT®), this 2-step autoinjector features a permanently concealed needle, removing the need for patients to manually attach the needle before each use, thereby enhancing ease of use and safety.

GRAM brings significant experience in aseptic fill-finish to their partners. GRAM’s drive to improve patient care and increase collaboration on drug delivery devices will greatly benefit pharmaceutical clients through this partnership.

The partnership allows SHL Medical and GRAM to offer pharmaceutical companies an integrated solution for large volume autoinjectors combining SHL’s expertise in developing and manufacturing innovative drug delivery solutions and GRAM’s unique experience with filling large volume containers. Pharmaceutical organizations can now benefit from an established supply chain and faster market entry for the Maggie® 5.0 autoinjector.

Markus Puusepp, SHL Medical’s Chief Growth Officer, commented on the collaboration: "The partnership with GRAM underlines our commitment to providing comprehensive solutions that address the growing needs of our pharmaceutical partners. By combining SHL’s innovative drug delivery systems with GRAM’s expertise in aseptic fill-finish, we are well-positioned to bring effective solutions to market more efficiently, benefiting both our partners and the patients they serve."

Dave Powell, Vice President of Business Development at Grand River Aseptic Manufacturing, added: "We are thrilled to partner with SHL Medical to support the Maggie® 5.0 autoinjector. This partnership supports GRAM’s vision of being recognized as a CDMO leader in both fill and finish services and drug delivery solutions. Our patient-centered culture and dedication to our partner’s success align perfectly with SHL’s dedication to innovation in drug delivery. Together, we are creating a streamlined solution that will offer significant value to pharmaceutical companies and, ultimately, patients.”

 

About Grand River Aseptic Manufacturing, Inc.

Grand River Aseptic Manufacturing, Inc., a prominent aseptic fill-finish contract development and manufacturing organization, delivers biologics, small molecules, and vaccine capabilities for liquid and lyophilized vials, syringes, and cartridges. Grand River Aseptic Manufacturing’s 450,000 sq. ft. of sophisticated GMP space supports customers’ drug products with advanced equipment, innovative technology, and a breadth of experienced team members.

For additional information, visit https://www.grandriverasepticmfg.com/

item.title: Revolutionizing autoinjector assembly with SHL’s Semi-Modular Automatic Robot Track
item.dc:creator: shl_manager2
item.content:encoded:
SHL Medical is excited to announce the publication of its latest article in World Pharmaceutical Frontiers, featuring its innovative Semi-Modular Automatic Robot Track, or SMART. The article takes a closer look on SHL’s SMART system and its role in addressing the increasing demand for high-mix/low-volume production while maintaining the flexibility and efficiency that modern drug development requires.

SMART combines the versatility of manual processes with the efficiency and reliability of automated systems, making it possible to produce smaller batches without compromising on quality or speed. Capable of reaching an annual capacity of 7.5-10 million devices while requiring two or three times less labor than manual assembly setups, SMART can be adapted to assemble various devices, such as SHL’s Molly® and Molly 2.25 mL autoinjectors, all on the same equipment.

Some of the key features highlighted in the article include SMART’s modular design, which allows for quick project changeovers, and its six-axis robots that enable precise and flexible motions. The article also discusses the benefits of SMART’s software and data control system – built on SHL’s extensive experience in automation – in ensuring consistent and transferable data across different projects.

 
Download full article

 

SMART’s success in supporting the assembly of a newly launched combination product for atopic disorders, offers a promising look into the system’s potential to transform the injection device manufacturing landscape.

item.title: Redefining possibilities with SHL’s new reusable electromechanical autoinjector
item.dc:creator: shl_manager2
item.content:encoded:
In the October issue of ONdrug Delivery magazine, SHL Medical’s Vince Masciopinto introduces Elexy™, our reusable electromechanical autoinjector designed to support combination product development at every stage—preclinical, clinical, and commercial. The article details how Elexy delivers a broad range of injection profiles with the simplicity of loading a new drug cassette, making it a versatile solution for evolving drug delivery needs.

As the landscape of parenteral drug delivery shifts, the demand for devices that address unmet needs in both product development and patient care grows. Managing parameters such as injection volume, rate, and viscosity with single-use mechanical devices can be expensive and time-consuming, especially for chronic conditions requiring multiple or variable doses. Elexy supports the simplification of this process, offering a streamlined solution for patients and developers alike.

The article highlights Elexy’s key strengths – flexibility, reusability, connectivity, and ease of use – to address critical challenges across development and commercial stages. In preclinical studies, Elexy can support flexible experimental design for evaluating injection performance. During clinical trials, Elexy can allow for a seamless transition from trial to commercial use, reducing development risk and lifecycle management costs while accelerating time-to-market.

At the commercial stage, Elexy’s reusable power unit offers potential advantages for dynamic treatment plans. Whether patients require variable doses or multi-dose therapies, the device ensures a consistent user experience across every injection. Its RFID-enabled drug cassettes are designed to provide accurate delivery parameters without user intervention, and its multi-level feedback mechanisms can further enhance usability and minimize the risk of user errors. Download and read the full article for a deeper dive on what Elexy has to offer.

 
Download the full article

 

As the pioneering leader in the self-injection space, SHL Medical continues to lead the way in developing innovative solutions for both pharma and patients. Elexy, with its wide range of injection profiles and best-in-class user experience, is set to redefine possibilities for injectable drug delivery.

item.title: SHL Medical announces plans to establish SHL Advantec
item.dc:creator: shl_manager1
item.content:encoded:
ZUG, Switzerland, NOV 21, 2024 -- SHL Medical, a world leader in self-injection solutions, today announced plans to establish SHL Advantec – a dynamic sub-group dedicated to providing tooling and automation solutions to the healthcare sector and other industries.

The establishment of SHL Advantec is part of SHL Medical’s ambitious expansion strategy and ongoing commitment to improving the lives of patients. The strategic move will allow SHL Medical to further focus on growing its business in self-injection devices while SHL Advantec provides advanced manufacturing and packaging technologies for medical devices and other healthcare products.

SHL Medical’s existing tooling and automation operations will be integrated into SHL Advantec, bringing their range of technologies, services, and equipment portfolio to the new business. Together with SHL Medical’s recent strategic acquisitions – Swiss-based LCA Automation and SMC Mould Innovation and US-based Superior Tooling – SHL Advantec will form a global operations network spanning three continents to deliver faster support and shorter supply chain services to SHL Advantec’s diverse customer base. Leveraging its experience in medical devices and other industries, SHL Advantec will focus on helping its customers advance production quality and resilience while continuing to support SHL Medical’s growth in autoinjector manufacturing.

“SHL Medical has always taken pride in being a true end-to-end solutions provider of autoinjector development and manufacturing, and part of that pride is built on our much-trusted tooling and automation solutions, which had been the backbone of SHL Medical’s ability to scale up production for our customers,” said Ulrich Faessler, CEO of SHL Medical. “As we prepare to pioneer the next era of innovative self-injection solutions, the strategic move will give SHL Medical and SHL Advantec the opportunity to maximize our strengths, both separately and collectively, to create more long-term value to our customers, their patients, and the entire pharmaceutical and healthcare value chain.”

SHL Advantec will be headquartered in Zug, Switzerland and will begin operations with over 600 dedicated employees across its offices and production sites in Switzerland, China, Taiwan, Mexico, and the US.

item.title: SHL Medical boosts talent growth in Taiwan with donation
item.dc:creator: shl_manager2
item.content:encoded:
November 21, 2024 – Taoyuan, Taiwan – SHL Medical, a pioneering leader in self-injection solutions, has made a significant contribution to developing future talents in Taiwan by donating the Electropuls® E10000, an all-electric dynamic testing machine, to the R&D Center for Smart Manufacturing at Chung Yuan Christian University (CYCU). This initiative reinforces SHL Medical’s long-standing commitment to empowering the next generation of innovators and strengthening academic collaboration.  

The Electropuls E10000 enables both static and dynamic testing of materials, such as plastics and metals, and other components, featuring oil-free linear and rotary motor technology for clean operation and high dynamic performance. This donation offers students hands-on experience using advanced material testing technology, boosting their practical skills and research capabilities. In addition, SHL Medical will support the implementation process, and offer technical support and training to ensure students are fully equipped to operate this industry-grade equipment.   

“This donation marks a significant milestone in our efforts to equip students with the tools and skills they need to thrive in the fast-evolving medtech landscape,” said Peter Heuberger, SHL Medical’s Global Head of Testing and Simulation. “By providing access to this testing machine, we aim to inspire students and elevate their learning experience.” 

Professor Yi-Feng Lin, the Dean of Engineering College at CYCU, expressed his gratitude, “We deeply appreciate SHL Medical’s generous donation. It not only enriches our educational resources but also prepares students for their future careers.” 

SHL Medical has been collaborating with CYCU since early this year as a broader initiative to bridge the gap between academia and industry. This partnership includes an internship program aimed at cultivating the next generation of talents, offering valuable opportunities to students from CYCU and other universities across Taiwan.  

The program exposes students to various facets of autoinjector developments, providing invaluable hands-on experience and practical training. Aligned with SHL Medical’s dedication to driving innovation through diverse perspectives, the program engages both local and international students. Participants work within the company’s manufacturing and development facilities, gaining essential skills and knowledge for successful careers in the medtech industry.  

“As a global company with deep roots in Taiwan, we are committed to investing in various talent development initiatives that empower students to excel,” said Sebastian Feng, General Manager of SHL Medical Taiwan. “By partnering with academic institutions, we cultivate a diverse talent pipeline that embodies our commitment to innovation and excellence.” 

An integral part of this talent development initiative includes organizing on-site visits to SHL Medical’s state-of-the-art facilities in Taiwan. These tours offer students firsthand insights into the complexities of autoinjector manufacturing. During these visits, students have the opportunity to engage directly with industry professionals and observe innovative processes, deepening their understanding of how SHL Medical’s work contributes to enhancing patient care.   

SHL Medical’s talent development initiative is fully aligned with its strategic goals of innovation and corporate social responsibility. Through this program, the company fosters a culture of creativity, diversity, and collaboration, ensuring that future leaders in medical technology are well-prepared to enable patients’ independence.

item.title: SHL Medical honored with AQM awards for excellence in quality and innovation
item.dc:creator: shl_manager2
item.content:encoded:
November 20, 2024 – Taoyuan, Taiwan – SHL Medical is pleased to announce that it has received two prestigious awards from the Association of Quality Managers (AQM) for its outstanding achievements in continuous improvement. Honored in the categories of Development and Innovation and Quality Improvement, SHL Medical’s dedication to advancing quality-driven processes, operational efficiency, and innovative practices was recognized. These award-winning initiatives are expected to achieve significant cost savings.   

The Development and Innovation Award acknowledges SHL Medical’s successful optimization of its quality control processes. To reduce the complexity of having various testing equipment setups for our comprehensive product portfolio, the company integrates all the variance into an advanced testing equipment. This approach allowed SHL Medical to successfully optimize labor requirements and its operational footprint, achieving process efficiency and exceptional cost savings. The accomplishments reflect SHL Medical’s strategic focus on leveraging innovative solutions to streamline operations.   

The Quality Improvement Award commends SHL Medical’s exceptional efforts to minimize rework rates of gate insert manufacturing in tooling. By utilizing the DMAIC framework and statistical methods, the team systematically investigated the issues, such as gate deviation and poor concentricity, and developed an optimal solution to address the problems. As a result, SHL Medical’s team effectively brought the rework rate down to 0%, resulting in substantial improvements and cost savings.

Reflecting on the team’s success, Tracy Pedreso, Director of Continuous Improvement at SHL Medical, expressed his pride, "Being recognized by a reputable organization validates our CI methodologies, highlights the teams' innovativeness, and boosts morale. It demonstrates our commitment to process improvement, operational efficiency, and continuous innovation through cross-functional collaboration and leveraging our knowledge of Lean principles or Six Sigma tools.”  

Sebastian Feng, General Manager of SHL Medical Taiwan, added, “These awards highlight SHL Medical’s dedication to operational excellence and continuous improvement. Our focus on quality and efficiency not only enhances our processes but also strengthens SHL Medical’s reputation as the leader in the industry.”   

Presented on November 20 at the Lakeshore Hotel in Hsinchu, Taiwan, these awards mark another milestone in SHL Medical’s ongoing efforts to promote quality and innovation. This recognition builds on two awards received in 2023, highlighting the company’s sustained commitment to continuous improvement.

item.title: SHL Medical shortlisted for the Pharmapack Awards 2025
item.dc:creator: shl_manager2
item.content:encoded:
SHL Medical is proud to announce that both Elexy™ and its dual-chamber cartridge autoinjectors have been shortlisted for the prestigious Pharmapack Awards 2025 in the Delivery and Device Innovation category. This recognition highlights SHL Medical’s commitment to advancing self-injection technologies that empower patients and enhance the treatment experience.

The Pharmapack Awards are highly regarded within the pharmaceutical and drug delivery industries, celebrating advancements that improve patient outcomes and set new standards in drug delivery. Being shortlisted affirms SHL Medical’s leadership in developing pioneering solutions that address the complex needs of modern healthcare.

SHL Medical’s Elexy is a versatile, electromechanical autoinjector designed for multi-use applications. Capable of supporting both pre-filled syringe and cartridge-based drug containers with injection volumes of up to 5.0 mL, Elexy provides pharmaceutical companies with a flexible solution across various stages of drug development. With integrated cellular and RFID connectivity, Elexy facilitates secure data collection to gather comprehensive injection insights and support optimized treatment outcomes.

SHL Medical’s new dual-chamber autoinjector, featuring its proprietary Needle Isolation Technology (NIT®), enables automatic reconstitution and safe delivery of lyophilized drugs. This innovative device simplifies drug mixing and administration, prioritizing safety and usability while maintaining drug integrity. Building on the success of SHL Medical’s Maggie® platforms – including the Maggie 5.0 mL, which was shortlisted for the CPHI Award in 2022 – this autoinjector further expands the company’s autoinjector offerings.

The winners of the 2025 Pharmapack Awards will be announced at Pharmapack Europe in Paris on January 22–23. SHL Medical will also be exhibiting at Booth #F101, where attendees can explore its comprehensive device portfolio and learn more about the SHL Medical’s commitment to advancing patient-centered solutions.
